drive.common.name: Name
drive.common.pageUseInfo: How would I use this page?
drive.common.pageUseCaseInfo: This page serves the following use cases:
drive.common.wanttosave: Would you like to save your changes?

drive.overview.interfaceFilter: By selecting eoe0, only the configured EtherCAT slaves are displayed.

help.useCase1: By default, all drives are displayed that can be accessed via the interface eoe0.
help.useCase2: If you would like to also see drives that can be accessed via the interface XF10, you can activate this via the filter.
help.useCase3: You can perform a full-text search by properties and sort the columns.
help.useCase4: Basic type plate data are displayed by expanding the device row.
help.useCase5: The device overview in ctrlX DRIVE Engineering opens by clicking the device type.
help.useCase6: The axis overview in ctrlX DRIVE Engineering opens by clicking the axis name.
help.useCase7: You can see the help on the diagnostics by clicking the current diagnostics.
help.useCase8: The diagnostic trace in ctrlX DRIVE Engineering can be opened here.

drive.drivebackup.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe the purpose of your backup here
drive.drivebackup.backupInfo: Downloads the last created backup to the computer
drive.drivebackup.compatibilityWarning: This dialog is a prototype. Please be aware that the created backup file is not compatible with the C sample of the DRIVE connect App. The created backup file in the C sample will be compatible with Serial Setup.
drive.drivebackup.backupUseInfo: Select the devices you want to backup in the "Backup" column. If a firmware suitable for the device is available in the DRIVE connect memory, the firmware file can be added to the backup via the option in the "Firmware" column.
drive.drivebackup.descriptionAttachment1: Please name and describe your backup.
drive.drivebackup.descriptionAttachment2: The backup will be stored as a separate ctrlX DRIVE Serial Setup project file (*.iwssproj). The project files can be viewed and managed here:
drive.drivebackup.descriptionAttachment3: Use "Manage Drive Package Backups" to go to the backup directory in the active App data.

help.useCase1: stores the current parameter and firmware configuration as a named backup archive of the drive package for later restoring the configuration of this drive package.
help.useCase2: creates a template for serial commissioning a similar drive package.

drive.replacement.noBackupDataToolTip: No matching backup data found for restore procedure.
drive.replacement.compatibilityWarning: This dialog is a prototype. Please be aware that the backup file format is not compatible with the C sample of the DRIVE connect App. The backup file format in the C sample will be compatible with Serial Setup.
drive.replacement.notReadyForRestore: The device is not yet ready for restore procedure. Please expand the row.
drive.replacement.hasToBeInPreOP: All axes have to be in Pre-OP so that the restore procedure can be carried out. Please expand the row.
drive.replacement.hasToBeInCM: All axes have to be in CM so that the restore procedure can be carried out. Please expand the row.
drive.replacement.hasToBeInPM: All axes have to be in PM so that the restore procedure can be carried out. Please expand the row.
drive.replacement.zwischenkreisGeladen: The DC bus has to be discharged so that the restore procedure can be carried out.
drive.replacement.zwischenkreisNichtMehrGeladen: The DC bus has been discharged, the restore procedure can be carried out.
drive.replacement.zwischenkreisNochGeladen: The DC bus is still charged, restore procedure not possible.

drives.panel-activation.securityInfo: Attention: By activating Engineering via the Panel, the Security requirements of ctrlX CORE are no longer ensured!

drive.firmwaredownload.cSampleWarning: This dialog is a prototype. Please be aware that the drive has to be ready for performing a firmware update. You have to provide these conditions yourself (drive in CM and PreOP, DC bus discharged). After the firmware update you have to reboot the drive so that the new firmware is activated.
drive.firmwaredownload.helpLink: Please refer to the help behind this link.
drive.firmwaredownload.skipUpdate: The firmware update is only performed if the check box has been activated
